paragraphs.content: Chapter 28
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 28

paragraphs.content: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

paragraphs.content: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

paragraphs.content: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

paragraphs.content: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

paragraphs.content: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

paragraphs.content: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

paragraphs.content: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture’s eye hath not seen:
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture’s eye hath not seen:

paragraphs.content: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

paragraphs.content: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

paragraphs.content: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

paragraphs.content: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

paragraphs.content: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

paragraphs.content: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

paragraphs.content: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.

paragraphs.content: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

paragraphs.content: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

paragraphs.content: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

paragraphs.content: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

paragraphs.content: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

paragraphs.content: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?

paragraphs.content: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

paragraphs.content: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

paragraphs.content: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

paragraphs.content: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

paragraphs.content: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

paragraphs.content: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

paragraphs.content: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

paragraphs.content: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
